title: Understanding Fatigue
content: Fatigue is a physiological state of reduced mental and physical capability. It results from sleep loss, time awake, circadian disruption, and sustained effort. Fatigued people have impaired judgment, slower reactions, increased errors, and—critically—poor awareness of their impairment.

mcq.question: A person who has been awake for 24 hours has impairment roughly equivalent to what blood alcohol level?
mcq.explanation: Research shows 24-hour wakefulness produces impairment similar to legal intoxication. We accept that drunk operation is unsafe but often treat fatigue as a personal choice. Both impair safety-critical performance.

openQuestions: How do you know when you're too fatigued to perform safely?
